FailReasons.description: 当使用read_timing_data命令读取timing数据时，如果指定目录中缺少必要文件或文件格式不符合要求，或者在memory_saving_mode模式下执行了不支持的操作，将会报告此错误。该命令需要特定命名格式的文件，并且在内存优化模式下会丢弃未使用的引脚数据。
FailReasons.solution:
1. 确保数据目录包含所有必要文件并符合预定义命名格式
2. 检查文件路径是否正确：read_timing_data -data_dir "/正确路径/" 
3. 避免在memory_saving_mode模式下调整path slack或混合不同场景报告
4. 如需保留完整数据，关闭memory_saving_mode参数：-memory_saving_mode

FailReasons.name: NET_not_found
reasons: The net 'net3156' was not found in the existing design.
The DEF file may contain a net that is not present in the Verilog design.
FailReasons.description: The error occurs when a net specified in the DEF file is not found in the linked Verilog design. This typically indicates a mismatch between the physical design (DEF) and the logical design (Verilog).
FailReasons.solution:
1. Use the report_design_file_status command with the -only_error and -truncate options to identify the exact location of the error in the DEF file.
2. Verify the net 'net3156' in the Verilog design to ensure it is defined and properly connected.
3. Check the DEF file for any discrepancies in the net naming or connections.
4. Correct the DEF file or update the Verilog design to align the net definitions.

FailReasons.name: ZeroCandidates
reasons: Number of candidates is zero
The given index is larger than number of candidates
FailReasons.description: The commit_candidate command will report errors when there are no candidates available or when the provided index exceeds the number of candidates.
FailReasons.solution: Ensure there are candidates available before running the command. Use the appropriate command to generate or load candidates. Verify the index value is within the valid range [0, number of candidates). Example: commit_candidate -index 5 (ensure there are at least 6 candidates).

FailReasons.name: IndexExceedsCandidates
reasons: The given index is larger than number of candidates.
Number of candidates is zero.
FailReasons.description: This command will commit specified candidate. It will report errors when following happens: Number of candidates is zero. The given index is larger than number of candidates.
FailReasons.solution: Ensure there are candidates available before executing the command. Verify the index value is within the valid range [0, number_of_candidates). Use the command with a valid index, for example: commit_candidate -index 5 (ensure that there are at least 6 candidates in the table model).

reasons: Any of the library cells does not exist.
The timing library cell is not complete for all corners.
Any of the specified is not a buffer or inverter.
The specified pins are not on the same net.
The net has no driver or more than one driver.
Buffer more than one pins on a net with equivalent nets.
FailReasons.description: The insert_buffer command will report errors for the following situations: if any of the library cells does not exist, if the timing library cell is not complete for all corners, if any of the specified is not a buffer or inverter, if the specified pins are not on the same net, if the net has no driver or more than one driver, or if multiple pins on a net with equivalent nets are being buffered.
FailReasons.solution: Ensure that all specified library cells exist and are correctly defined in the timing library for all corners. Verify that the specified pins are on the same net and that the net has a single driver. When using the insert_buffer command, confirm that the cells provided are either buffers or inverters. If inserting inverters, use the -inverter_pair option to insert them in pairs. Additionally, make sure that when buffering multiple pins on a net, the nets are not equivalent.

FailReasons.name: BufferMoreThanOnePinWithEquivalentNets
reasons: The net has more than one driver.
Buffer more than one pins on a net with equivalent nets.
FailReasons.description: This error occurs when attempting to buffer more than one pin on a net that has equivalent nets. Equivalent nets are those that are logically the same but may exist in different physical hierarchies. This situation can lead to timing and placement issues, especially when buffers are inserted across different design hierarchies without proper specification of the target design.
FailReasons.solution: To resolve this issue, ensure that the net being buffered has only one driver. If the net has multiple drivers, consider consolidating them or using the -design option to specify the exact design hierarchy where the buffer should be inserted. For example: insert_buffer -design {target_design} {pin} {cell_type} where target_design is the specific design hierarchy where the buffer should be placed.

FailReasons.name: LibraryCellNotExist
reasons: The library cell does not exist
FailReasons.description: The command attempts to insert a buffer or inverter on the net containing the specified pin, but the specified library cell is not available in the design.
FailReasons.solution: Verify the library cell name is correct and exists in the design. Use the 'insert_dummy_cell' command with the correct lib_cell parameter. If the cell is missing, create it in the library or use an existing cell.

FailReasons.name: MultiplePinsSpecified
reasons: More than one specified pin is given.
FailReasons.description: The command will report an error when more than one specified pin is given.
FailReasons.solution: Use the list_insert_buffer_candidates command with only a single pin. For example: list_insert_buffer_candidates -design {design_name} {single_pin} [other_options]

FailReasons.name: PinNotExistInDesign
reasons: The given pin is not exist in specified design.
FailReasons.description: The command reports an error when the specified pin does not exist in the given design.
FailReasons.solution: Verify the pin name and design name for correctness. Ensure the pin exists in the design. Use the correct syntax with the -design option followed by the valid design name and the pin name. Example: list_insert_buffer_candidates -design {cpu} U318/I -inverter -dont_use

FailReasons.name: MoreThanOneCellSpecified
reasons: More than one specified cell is given.
FailReasons.description: This command will report an error when more than one specified cell is given. The command only supports sizing a single cell.
FailReasons.solution: Ensure only one cell is specified in the command. For example: list_size_cell_candidates -design {design_name} {cell_name} [other_options]

FailReasons.name: CellNotExistInDesign
reasons: The given cell is not exist in specified design.
FailReasons.description: The command reports an error when the specified cell does not exist in the given design.
FailReasons.solution: Verify the cell name and design name. Use the correct cell name that exists in the specified design. Example command: list_size_cell_candidates -design {design_name} {cell_name} -by_function -dont_use

FailReasons.name: TimingLibraryCellIncomplete
reasons: Any of the timing library cells of specified instances is not complete for all corners
The timing library cell is not complete for all corners.
FailReasons.description: The timing library cells for the specified instances are not complete for all process, voltage, and temperature (PVT) corners. This can lead to inaccurate timing analysis and potential design failures. The timing library cell is not complete for all corners. This can lead to errors during the split_net command execution as the necessary timing data for different corners is missing.
FailReasons.solution: Ensure that the timing library cell used in the split_net command is complete for all required corners. Verify the library cell's availability and completeness across all corners. If the library cell is incomplete, replace it with a complete cell or update the library to include missing corner data. Ensure that the timing library for the specified cells is complete for all corners. Verify the library files are correctly imported and check for missing corner data. Use the 'check_timing_library' command to validate completeness.

FailReasons.name: LibCellNotExist
reasons: The library cell does not exist.
Specified is not a buffer or inverter.
The timing library cell is not complete for all corners.
FailReasons.description: When using the split_net command, if the specified library cell does not exist, or the cell is not a buffer/inverter, or the timing library cell is incomplete for all corners, the command will fail with an error.
FailReasons.solution: Verify the existence of the library cell in the design. Ensure that the specified cell is a buffer or inverter. Check that the timing library cell is complete for all corners. Use the correct cell name in the -lib_cell parameter, e.g., BUFFX4 or BUFFX6. Example command: split_net -design {cpu} -lib_cell {BUFFX4} -segment 3 -rule wire_length {sub/C32/n246}

FailReasons.name: The net has equivalent net
reasons: The net has equivalent net.
FailReasons.description: When splitting a net, if the net has an equivalent net, the operation may not be able to proceed as expected. This typically occurs when there is another net with the same electrical characteristics or connectivity, which can lead to ambiguity or conflicts during the net splitting process.
FailReasons.solution: To resolve this issue, ensure that there are no equivalent nets before attempting to split the net. This can be done by checking and modifying the design to remove or differentiate the equivalent net. If the equivalent net is not required, consider removing it from the design. If it is necessary, ensure that the net splitting command is adjusted to handle such cases, possibly by using different rules or parameters for splitting.

FailReasons.name: fail_reason
reasons: slack less than unreasonable_negative_slack
corresponding scenario and timing type is set as skipped
FailReasons.description: The command summarizes the violation information of specified timing paths, including violation count, worst slack, total negative slack. Paths with slack less than unreasonable_negative_slack or skipped scenarios/timing types are ignored. When -with_fail_reason is used, it provides statistical summary of fail reasons on top n paths.
FailReasons.solution: Use the -with_fail_reason flag with -with_top_n to get fail reasons. Example: summarize_path_violations -with_top_n 3 -with_fail_reason

FailReasons.name: fail reasons
reasons: critical paths to top n endpoints
corresponding automatic fix flow has not been applied
exceeding upper bound of 10000 for top n endpoints in detail format
FailReasons.description: Report statistical summary of fail reasons on critical paths to top n endpoints. If a corresponding automatic fix flow has been applied, a statistical fail reason summary can also be displayed for each top n endpoint with option -with_fail_reason. Once -with_path_detail is specified, the summary of path list will be reported in detail format as those on GUI, and the data path timing of each path will be reported also. In the detail format, there will be an upper bound 10000 for top n to avoid large size of report.
FailReasons.solution: Use the -with_fail_reason option to report statistical summary of fail reasons. Apply the corresponding automatic fix flow if needed. Use -with_top_n to specify the number of top endpoints. If using -with_path_detail, ensure that the top n does not exceed 10000 to avoid large report size.

FailReasons.name: TransitionViolationFailReason
reasons: Transition violations on clock network
Transition violations on data path
Pins not marked as dont touch are included in summary
Endpoints on io or internal r2r paths are not properly identified
No corresponding automatic fix flow applied
FailReasons.description: This command summarizes transition violations in design, including violation count, worst slack, and total negative slack. Fail reasons can be displayed for top n pins if automatic fix flow is applied.
FailReasons.solution: Use -with_fail_reason option with -with_top_n to display fail reasons. Apply corresponding automatic fix flow if available. Use -exclude_dont_touch to ignore pins marked as dont touch. Verify pin attributes with is_dont_touch command.

FailReasons.name: Split net with inverter
reasons: Buffered pins are not in the same logic hierarchy when insert buffer or split net
Insert individual inverter when insert buffer chain
Insert AND/OR cell as buffer in post-mask eco
FailReasons.description: By default, macro commands will be output. However, it will report errors when following happens: --Buffered pins are not in the same logic hierarchy when insert buffer or split net. --Split net with inverter. --Insert individual inverter when insert buffer chain. --Insert AND/OR cell as buffer in post-mask eco.
FailReasons.solution: Use -write_atomic_cmd option to write out atomic eco commands instead of macro commands. Or force to dump the macro commands with -force option. If mixed commands are not convenient, use -reorder option to put all atomic commands at the end.

FailReasons.name: CapacitanceViolationFixFail
reasons: Insufficient buffer resources to fix all capacitance violations
Specific pin constraints preventing buffer insertion
Design constraints limiting the placement of buffers or inverters
Inadequate area or density resources to resolve violations
FailReasons.description: The command attempts to fix capacitance violations in the design but may fail to resolve all violations due to various constraints and resource limitations. After the fix process, it reports statistics on fail reasons, allowing users to adjust policies or allocate more resources accordingly.
FailReasons.solution:
1. Use the report_fail_reasons command to analyze detailed reasons on specific objects.
2. Adjust buffer_list to include more appropriate buffers or inverters.
3. Modify design constraints to allow buffer insertion where necessary.
4. Release additional area or density resources in the design.

FailReasons.name: break setup fail reasons
reasons: Many break setup fail reasons are found in summary
FailReasons.description: When the option -fix_timing_window is specified, tool will try to size a few driver cells on the path of the pins which setup margin are always broken, so there's a chance to get a better setup margin after sizing.
FailReasons.solution: Use the -fix_timing_window option with appropriate effort level. Example command: fix_timing -fix_timing_window -effort medium

FailReasons.name: FailReasons
reasons: 指定的违规端点（endpoints）数量不足，小于unreasonable_negative_slack阈值
未指定违反的引脚（pins）进行修复，导致无法确定需要修复的违规项
在使用-only_pins参数时，其他引脚被标记为dont touch，限制了可生成解决方案的范围
未正确设置或识别违规引脚的扇入（fan in）和扇出（fan out）引脚，导致无法形成子图进行解决方案搜索
FailReasons.description: 该失败原因与修复特定违规引脚（pins）时遇到的限制和条件有关。当指定违规端点时，工具会追踪其所有扇入和扇出引脚以形成子图搜索解决方案。然而，如果指定的违规端点数量不足（小于unreasonable_negative_slack阈值），则这些端点将被忽略。此外，使用-only_pins参数时，其他引脚被标记为dont touch，可能限制了解决方案的生成。若未正确指定违规引脚或未正确追踪相关引脚，也可能导致失败。
FailReasons.solution:
1. 确保指定的违规端点数量足够，大于等于unreasonable_negative_slack阈值。
2. 明确指定需要修复的违规引脚（pins）。
3. 在使用-only_pins参数时，确保所指定的引脚能够覆盖所有需要修复的违规项，避免不必要的限制。
4. 检查并正确设置违规引脚的扇入和扇出关系，确保子图的正确生成。

FailReasons.name: disable_report
reasons: 生成违规和失败原因报告时违反了最大违规数限制（默认10000）
用户主动使用-disable_report参数禁用报告生成
FailReasons.description: 默认情况下，工具会在工作区的opt目录下生成违规和失败原因报告。由于大量违规可能导致性能问题，因此设置了最大违规数限制（默认10000）。使用-disable_report参数可以禁用此报告生成。
FailReasons.solution: 若需保留报告，可移除-disable_report参数；若需调整最大违规数限制，可在启动命令中添加 -max_violation_count <数值> 参数。例如：tool_command -max_violation_count 20000

FailReasons.name: transition_violations
reasons: transition violations in design
FailReasons.description: This command fixes transition violations in design. Once the fix process finished, it will report the gain obtained, area and density variations. If the violations are not completely fixed, the statistics of fail reasons will also be reported.
FailReasons.solution: Use the command with appropriate buffer_list and debug_pins parameters. If violations remain, use report_fail_reasons to review detailed reasons and adjust policies or release more resources.

FailReasons.name: wire_length_violations
reasons: Wire length exceeds the max wire length threshold defined by the user.
Insufficient buffer/inverter resources to fix all violations.
Too many violations remaining after fixing process, exceeding the maximum limit of 10000.
FailReasons.description: Wire length violations occur when the length of a wire in the design exceeds the specified maximum threshold. The tool attempts to fix these by splitting nets or inserting buffers/inverters. If violations remain unfixed, a report detailing the fail reasons is generated.
FailReasons.solution: Use the fix_wire_length_violations command with appropriate parameters. For example: fix_wire_length_violations -max_wire_length <threshold> -buffer_list <buffer_names>. If violations persist, consider increasing the max_wire_length threshold or adding more buffers/inverters to the buffer_list. For specific pins, specify them directly in the command.

FailReasons.name: break_hold
reasons: Hold constraint is broken while fixing setup
Hold constraint is broken while optimizing leakage
Hold constraint is broken while optimizing area
Hold slack becomes negative
FailReasons.description: The hold constraint is broken while fixing setup, optimize leakage or area. Only when the hold slack gets worse and becomes negative, the solution will be abandoned and this reason is marked. It can be relaxed by specifying a negative hold margin.
FailReasons.solution: Use the eco_hold_slack_margin command to specify a negative hold margin, which can relax the hold constraint check. For example: eco_hold_slack_margin -margin -0.1

FailReasons.name: break_setup
reasons: Setup timing violation due to insufficient slack in the timing path
Insufficient transition time for setup constraints
Excessive capacitance loading on the pin leading to timing issues
Setup constraint is broken while fixing hold, optimizing leakage or area.
Setup slack becomes negative
size_cell
FailReasons.description: The 'break_setup' failure reason indicates that there is a setup timing violation in the design. This occurs when the data signal arrives at the capture flip-flop too late relative to the clock signal, leading to potential data corruption. This can be caused by insufficient slack in the timing path, inadequate transition times, or excessive capacitance loading on the pin.
FailReasons.solution:
To resolve 'break_setup' issues, perform the following steps:
1. Use the 'report_fail_reasons' command with the '-verbose' option to identify specific pins and paths causing the issue.
2. Optimize the timing paths by adding buffer cells or adjusting the placement of logic cells to increase slack.
3. Check for excessive capacitance on the affected pins and consider reducing the load by adjusting the netlist or using smaller driver cells.
4. Use the 'set_timing_exceptions' command to create exceptions for specific paths if necessary, ensuring that critical paths are prioritized during optimization.
Use the eco_setup_slack_margin command to specify a negative setup margin. For example: eco_setup_slack_margin -setup -margin -0.1
使用get_failed_pins命令并指定-reasons参数为break_setup和-methods参数为size_cell，例如：get_failed_pins -reasons break_setup -methods size_cell

FailReasons.name: assigned_net
reasons: 当前网络已分配了网络，无法进行需要修改分配关系的ECO操作
尝试拆分网络或加载时被直接跳过
插入缓冲器到只有一个接收端或源端的缓冲器时被跳过（此时引脚到缓冲器是一个端口）
FailReasons.description: 当前网络已分配了网络。对于此类网络，任何需要更改分配关系的ECO操作都将被跳过，因为无法通过脚本导出此类更改。尝试拆分网络或加载时会被直接跳过。插入缓冲器到只有一个接收端或源端的缓冲器时也会被跳过，此时引脚到缓冲器是一个端口。
FailReasons.solution: 在执行ECO操作前，检查并确保目标网络未被分配。使用命令'check_net -assigned'验证网络状态。若存在分配，可通过'set_net -unassign <net_name>'解除分配后再进行操作。

FailReasons.name: break_max_capacitance
reasons: 在修复时序违规过程中，当前阶段的电容值可能因引脚或布线电容的变化而增加
电容违规情况变得更加严重
FailReasons.description: 当前解决方案违反了最大电容约束。在修复时序违规时，当前阶段的电容值可能由于引脚或布线电容的变化而增加。如果它打破了最大电容约束或电容违规情况变得更糟，当前解决方案将被放弃并标记此原因。
FailReasons.solution: 使用eco_capacitance_slack_margin命令进行调整，具体参数设置需根据实际设计需求和约束条件进行优化。

FailReasons.name: break_max_capacitance_of_driver
reasons: While fixing timing violations, the load of the driver cell perhaps gets bigger and capacitance constraint may be broken.
FailReasons.description: It breaks the max capacitance of the driver cell. It breaks the max capacitance. While fixing timing violations, the load of the driver cell perhaps gets bigger and capacitance constraint may be broken. It allows to break a slight margin. But if it breaks too much, the solution will be abandoned and this reason is marked.

FailReasons.name: break_max_transition
reasons: Max transition constraint violation
Signal transition time exceeds allowed limit
Timing path violation due to excessive signal transition
FailReasons.description: 当前解决方案打破了最大转换约束。在修复时序违规时，当前阶段的电容可能因引脚或布线电容的变化而增大。如果它打破了最大转换约束或转换违规变得更糟，当前解决方案将被放弃并标记此原因。
FailReasons.solution: 使用eco_transition_slack_margin命令调整过渡松弛度参数，以确保满足最大转换约束。具体步骤包括：1. 分析当前设计的转换违规情况；2. 使用eco_transition_slack_margin命令设置适当的松弛度值；3. 重新运行时序分析以验证约束是否满足。

FailReasons.name: break_max_transition_of_driver
reasons: 在修复时序违规时，驱动器单元的负载可能变得更大
转换约束可能被打破
FailReasons.description: 它打破了最大转换。在修复时序违规时，驱动器单元的负载可能变得更大，转换约束可能被打破。它允许打破轻微的余量。但如果打破太多，解决方案将被放弃，并标记此原因。
FailReasons.solution: 使用 -fix_hold 命令时，可以尝试增加 -max_transition 参数的值以允许更大的转换余量。例如：set_timing_constraints -max_transition 2.5。

FailReasons.name: cross_hierarchy_net
reasons: Current net crosses physical hierarchies.
FailReasons.description: Current net cross physical hierarchies. Before version 2021.03, it is not able to split such nets in optimization process. In version 2021.03, manual split net is enhanced to support cross hierarchy net, and in version 2021.09, split net is enhanced to support cross hierarchy in automatic optimization.
FailReasons.solution: For versions before 2021.03, manual splitting of nets across hierarchies is not supported. Starting from 2021.03, use the enhanced manual split net feature. For automatic optimization, ensure you are using version 2021.09 or later. Use the 'split_net' command with appropriate parameters to handle cross hierarchy nets during optimization.

FailReasons.name: cross_hierarchy_mib_net
reasons: Current net crosses physical hierarchies
Connected to MIB pins
FailReasons.description: Current net cross physical hierarchies, and connected to MIB pins. It is not able to split such nets in optimization process.
FailReasons.solution: Use the 'split_net' command with the '-h' parameter to specify hierarchy boundaries and ensure MIB pins are properly handled during the split process.

FailReasons.name: cross_multi_tech_design_net
reasons: Current net cross multiple tech designs.
FailReasons.description: Current net cross multiple tech designs. It is not able to split such nets in optimization process.
FailReasons.solution: To resolve this issue, you can use the 'split_net' command with the '-tech_design' parameter to split the net across different technology designs. Ensure that each segment of the net is assigned to a single technology design. Example: split_net -net <net_name> -tech_design <design_name>.

FailReasons.name: user_dont_touch_cell
reasons: 当前单元格被用户标记为dont touch
不允许对单元格进行尺寸调整
FailReasons.description: 当前单元格被标记为dont touch。不允许对单元格进行尺寸调整。dont touch状态通过命令set_dont_touch, set_hier_path_dont_touch标记。user_dont_touch_cell的优先级高于data_dont_touch_cell。
FailReasons.solution: 使用set_dont_touch命令或set_hier_path_dont_touch命令移除单元格的dont touch状态。例如：set_dont_touch -cell <cell_name> -remove。

FailReasons.name: data_dont_touch_cell
reasons: 当前单元被标记为dont touch，不允许调整大小
dont touch状态通过注释的时序数据或liberty_cell标记
FailReasons.description: 当前单元被标记为dont touch。不允许调整此单元的大小。dont touch状态通过注释的时序数据或liberty_cell标记。user_dont_touch_cell的优先级高于data_dont_touch_cell。
FailReasons.solution: 使用honor_annotated_dont_touch命令来处理注释的dont touch标记，或检查并修改liberty_cell设置以移除dont touch状态。

FailReasons.name: user_dont_touch_net
reasons: The net is marked as dont touch by the user using set_dont_touch or set_hier_path_dont_touch commands.
FailReasons.description: The net is marked as dont touch. And it is not allowed to insert or remove buffers from this net. The dont touch status is marked by the command set_dont_touch, set_hier_path_dont_touch. The user_dont_touch_net has higher precedence than data_dont_touch_net.
FailReasons.solution: To resolve this issue, remove the dont touch attribute from the net using the command: set_dont_touch -net <net_name> -remove. Replace <net_name> with the actual name of the net. Alternatively, if the net was marked using set_hier_path_dont_touch, use set_hier_path_dont_touch -path <path> -remove to remove the dont touch status.

FailReasons.name: data_dont_touch_net
reasons: Current net is marked as dont touch by timing data.
The user_dont_touch_net has higher precedence than data_dont_touch_net.
FailReasons.description: The net is marked as dont touch. And it is not allowed to insert or remove buffers from this net. The dont touch status is marked by the annotated timing data.
FailReasons.solution: Use the -honor_annotated_dont_touch option to control the behavior. Check the timing data annotations and modify them if necessary. If user_dont_touch_net is conflicting, ensure that it is correctly set according to design requirements.

FailReasons.name: dont_touch_pin
reasons: The pin is marked as dont touch, and is skipped in scanning process.
The dont touch status is marked with the annotated timing data or the command set_dont_touch.
FailReasons.description: The pin is marked as dont touch, and is skipped in scanning process. The dont touch status is marked with the annotated timing data or the command set_dont_touch.
FailReasons.solution: Use the set_dont_touch command to mark the pin as dont touch, or remove the dont touch status using the appropriate command.

FailReasons.name: break_minimum_cell_delay
reasons: When write sdf file for setup, XTop decreases cell delay, but can not break the minimum delay defined by reserved_cell_delay_percentage.
FailReasons.description: When write sdf file for setup, XTop decreases cell delay, but can not break the minimum delay defined by reserved_cell_delay_percentage.
FailReasons.solution: Adjust the reserved_cell_delay_percentage parameter to allow sufficient delay reduction. For example, use the command: set_timing_constraints -reserved_cell_delay_percentage <new_value>.

FailReasons.name: not_only_pin
reasons: 当前使用的pin不属于目标对象
在使用 -only_pins 参数或在 fix 命令中指定 pin 列表时，pin 不在目标范围内
FailReasons.description: 当使用 -only_pins 参数或在 fix 命令中指定 pin 列表时，所使用的 pin 不属于目标对象。
FailReasons.solution: 确保指定的 pin 属于目标对象。可以使用 get_dont_touch_pins 检查哪些 pin 被设置为 dont_touch，或者使用 set_dont_touch 命令设置需要保留的 pin。例如：set_dont_touch -objects [get_pins <pin_name>]。

FailReasons.name: legal_fail_congestion
reasons: The route is congest.
There is no place in the legalization range.
There is no matched row for the cell.
FailReasons.description: Can not legalize new instance because of congestion.
FailReasons.solution:
1. 使用 report_placement_constraint 命令查看 max congestion 值（通常 0.8-0.9），确认是否在合理范围内。
2. 使用 set_placement_constraint 命令扩大合法范围或允许 squeeze cells（注意：这可能导致一致性变差）。

FailReasons.name: legal_fail_no_space_on_row
reasons: 没有足够的空间在合法化范围内
route is congest
没有合适的行
LEF或DEF文件存在问题
design中存在filler单元，没有空地无法插buffer优化
FailReasons.description: 无法对新实例进行合法化，因为行上没有空间。
FailReasons.solution:
1. 使用check_placement_readiness命令确认design被正常导入，避免缺失LEF文件或DEF与tech LEF文件不一致的问题。
2. 使用set_removable_fillers {FILL*}命令处理design中存在filler单元，没有空地无法插buffer优化的情况。

FailReasons.name: feed_through_module
reasons: It caused a feed through in module while current buffer or inverter pair is removed.
FailReasons.description: It caused a feed through in module while current buffer or inverter pair is removed. Such action is skipped since it cannot export such a change with scripts.

FailReasons.name: floating_pin
reasons: The pin is floating.
FailReasons.description: The pin is floating. Commonly, it should be an exception that violation is found on a floating pin. So, it is skipped.

FailReasons.name: heavy_fanout_net
reasons: Current net has a heavy fanout.
FailReasons.description: Current net has a heavy fanout. It should be an exception and will be skipped. The fanout upper bound is set to 128 in this tool.
FailReasons.solution: Check and adjust the parameter eco_allow_optimize_heavy_fanout_net. Use the command: set_eco_param -name eco_allow_optimize_heavy_fanout_net -value <true|false> to enable or disable the optimization for heavy fanout nets.

FailReasons.name: incomplete_net
reasons: Current net has only source or sinks
Missing segments between source and sinks
FailReasons.description: Current net has only source or sink pins, or net segments are missing between source and sinks. This is an exception and will be skipped.

FailReasons.name: incomplete_timing_cell
reasons: Timing library cells are missing in some corners of the current cell
FailReasons.description: The timing lib cells are missing in some corners of current cell. Such cells will be skipped while sizing cells, or being inserted buffer since it is not able to evaluate the delay.
FailReasons.solution: Use the 'check_timing_library' command to verify that all required timing library cells are present for all corners. If missing, use 'add_timing_cells' with appropriate parameters to add the necessary cells.

FailReasons.name: input_port
reasons: Current pin is an input port
FailReasons.description: The pin is an input port of design. While splitting net, a net driven by a port is skipped.

FailReasons.name: invalid_power_frequency
reasons: The frequency of current pin is not invalid.
FailReasons.description: When optimize dynamic power, the frequency is invalid for current pin, so dynamic power can not be calculated correctly.

FailReasons.name: invalid_power_voltage
reasons: The voltage of current pin is not invalid.
FailReasons.description: When optimize dynamic power, the voltage is invalid for current pin, so dynamic power can not be calculated correctly.

FailReasons.name: invalid_reference_cell
reasons: The reference of current cell is not valid.
Something is wrong while importing LEF files.
FailReasons.description: The reference of current cell is not valid. It needs to check if something is wrong while importing LEF files.
FailReasons.solution: Check the LEF files for errors and ensure they are correctly imported. Use the 'check_lef' command to validate LEF files and correct any issues found.

FailReasons.name: large_area_to_size_up
reasons: Original cell is not allowed to be sized up to a very large cell
FailReasons.description: Original cell is not allowed to be sized up to a very large cell, the ratio is controlled by parameter eco_size_cell_area_change_ratio.
FailReasons.solution: Adjust the eco_size_cell_area_change_ratio parameter to allow larger area changes. For example: set eco_size_cell_area_change_ratio 2.0

FailReasons.name: large_input_transition
reasons: 输入转换太大，导致违反转换约束
端口上用户指定了较大的转换值
前一阶段存在转换违规且未能修复
FailReasons.description: 输入转换太大。这发生在修复转换违规时。违规不是由驱动单元或被驱动网络引起的，而是由于输入转换过大。例如，它是一个端口且用户在该端口上指定了较大的转换。或者前一阶段存在转换违规且未能修复。此类引脚会被跳过，因为仅通过在连接的网络或单元上应用ECO无法修复违规。
FailReasons.solution: 检查并调整端口的输入转换设置，确保其符合时序约束。使用工具的transition约束命令设置合理的转换值，例如：set_input_transition -max 0.5ns [get_ports {port_name}]。同时检查前一阶段是否存在未修复的转换违规，并进行相应的修复。

FailReasons.name: legal_fail_drc
reasons: Can not legalize new instance because of drc constraint.
FailReasons.description: Can not legalize new instance because of drc constraint.

FailReasons.name: legal_fail_no_available_row
reasons: No available row in the design area to place the new instance.
FailReasons.description: Cannot legalize new instance because no available row.
FailReasons.solution: Check the design area for available rows and ensure that there is sufficient space. Adjust the placement constraints or increase the design area size if necessary. Use the 'set_row' command to define or modify rows in the design area.

FailReasons.name: legal_fail_unplaced_cell
reasons: Unplaced cell exists in the design for soft legal mode
The design contains cells that have not been placed during legalization process
FailReasons.description: Can not legalize because unplaced cell for soft legal mode.
FailReasons.solution: Check the design for any unplaced cells using the 'check_design' command. Use the 'place_cell' command to manually place any unplaced cells. Ensure all cells are properly placed before running legalization. Example: check_design -unplaced; place_cell <cell_name> -location <x> <y>;

FailReasons.name: legal_fail_fixed_cell
reasons: Can not create try legal instance for fixed cell.
FailReasons.description: Can not create try legal instance for fixed cell.

FailReasons.name: legal_fail_locked_cell
reasons: Can not create try legal instance for locked cell.
FailReasons.description: Can not create try legal instance for locked cell.

FailReasons.name: module_not_unique
reasons: One of the ancestor module has been instantiated more than one times in the design
FailReasons.description: Current object is not unique in module domain. It means that one of the ancestor module has been instantiated more than one times in the design. Thus, there is no way to make a change just to current object since any change on current object will be reflected in all instantiations.
FailReasons.solution: Check if wrong Verilog files are imported. Ensure that the netlist is uniquified before delivering to back-end. Use the 'uniquify' command in the EDA tool with appropriate parameters to resolve duplicate module instantiations.

FailReasons.name: module_power_domain_conflict
reasons: The power domain of reference cell and its parent module not match
FailReasons.description: During eco process, the power domain of reference cell and its parent module not match, need to verify power domain setting.
FailReasons.solution: Use report_power_domain command to check power domain settings. Ensure that the power domain of the reference cell matches its parent module. If necessary, adjust the power domain settings using the set_power_domain command with appropriate parameters.

FailReasons.name: multi_driven_net
reasons: Current net has multiple drivers.
FailReasons.description: Current net has multiple drivers. This is a special structure and is skipped.

FailReasons.name: inout_pin_on_net
reasons: Current net has inout pin.
FailReasons.description: Current net has inout pin. This is a special structure and is skipped.

FailReasons.name: newly_created_object
reasons: Current object is newly created in optimization process.
FailReasons.description: The object is newly created in the optimization process. It avoids mixed optimization actions applied to the same pin before the whole iteration to keep the consistency of result.

FailReasons.name: no_alternative_cell
reasons: The cell does not have an alternative cell actually, which can be verified by report_matched_cells.
The attributes of cells or settings are not correct to match cells, which can be verified by reporting cell classification.
Alternative cells are already marked as don't use by user or in liberty file.
There is something wrong with the reference or timing library of all the alternative cells.
The current cell is the best while optimizing leakage or area, as alternative cells have worse leakage or area defined in liberty file.
For hold fix, all alternative cells have larger area, while only sizing down is accepted.
For capacitance fix, all alternative cells have smaller area, while only sizing up is accepted.
There exists special configuration on cells by command set_specific_lib_cells or set_lib_per_instance.
All alternative cells are not core cell type defined in reference library.
All alternative cells do not belong to the tech group same as target pin.
FailReasons.description: No alternative cell found while sizing current cell. It is reported in the following situations: ...
FailReasons.solution: Check if alternative cells exist using report_matched_cells. Verify cell attributes and settings with cell classification reports. Ensure alternative cells are not marked as don't use in liberty files. Check reference and timing libraries for errors. Adjust optimization settings if current cell is optimal for leakage/area. Use sizing down for hold fix and sizing up for capacitance fix. Review configurations from set_specific_lib_cells or set_lib_per_instance. Ensure alternative cells are core type and belong to the same tech group as target pin.

FailReasons.name: no_alternative_cell_by_multi_tech
reasons: XTop filters out candidate cells that do not belong to the same design tech as the reference cell
Candidate cells have no LEF data
FailReasons.description: No alternative cell found while sizing current cell, XTop will filter out candidate cells that not belong to same design tech as reference cell. Another possible reason is that candidate cells have no lef data.
FailReasons.solution: Ensure that all candidate cells belong to the same design technology as the reference cell. Verify that candidate cells have proper LEF data. Use the -tech option in the sizing command to specify the correct technology library, e.g., 'sizing -tech <tech_library> -reference <ref_cell> -candidate <candidate_cells>'.

FailReasons.name: no_available_buffer
reasons: Special library settings set by command set_specific_lib_cells or set_lib_per_instance
Current buffer is not a core cell type in the reference library
max_delay_buffer_length is set and normal buffer is not available at that time
FailReasons.description: No available buffer can be used to insert or split net. It is often caused by special library settings set by command set_specific_lib_cells or set_lib_per_instance, or current buffer is not core cell type in reference library. Another possible reason is max_delay_buffer_length is set, and normal buffer is not available at that time.
FailReasons.solution: Check and adjust the library settings using the commands set_specific_lib_cells or set_lib_per_instance. Ensure that the buffer used is a core cell type in the reference library. If max_delay_buffer_length is set, verify if normal buffers are available and adjust the setting if necessary.

FailReasons.name: no_available_buffer_by_multi_tech
reasons: No available buffer can be used to insert or split net
Multi tech design filter is applied, which filters out buffers not belonging to the same design tech as the reference pin
FailReasons.description: No available buffer can be used to insert or split net, XTop will filter out buffers that not belong to same design tech as reference pin.
FailReasons.solution: Check the design tech of the reference pin and ensure that buffers used are from the same design technology. Use the 'set_design_tech' command to set the appropriate technology for the design, and verify buffer compatibility with the reference pin's technology.

FailReasons.name: no_available_dummy_cell
reasons: No available dummy cell can be used to insert.
FailReasons.description: No available dummy cell can be used to insert.

FailReasons.name: no_valid_eco_cell
reasons: Candidate buffer or cell can not pass the site def check to reference cell
FailReasons.description: No valid eco cell can be found due to site def check.
FailReasons.solution: Check the site definitions in the design and ensure that the candidate buffer or cell meets the site def requirements. Use the 'check_site_def' command to verify site definitions and adjust the cell properties if necessary.

FailReasons.name: no_glitch_gain
FailReasons.description: There is no glitch gain for current solution.

FailReasons.name: no_si_gain
reasons: There is no SI gain for current solution
SI will be worse for some scenarios
FailReasons.description: There is no SI gain for current solution, or SI will be worse for some scenarios.

FailReasons.name: no_capacitance_gain
reasons: There is no capacitance gain for current solution.
The change of wire, SI are also taken into account.
FailReasons.description: There is no capacitance gain for current solution. The change of wire, SI are also taken into account. And for some special cases, it will be different with intuition.

FailReasons.name: no_capacitance_total_gain
reasons: There is no capacitance gain in total for current solution.
There exists gain for current net or pin, but the transition of the driver perhaps gets worst.
FailReasons.description: There is no capacitance gain in total for current solution. There exists gain for current net or pin, but the transition of the driver perhaps gets worst. A total gain will be calculated to judge if the design can benefit from current solution as a total.

FailReasons.name: no_hold_gain
reasons: There is no hold gain for current solution.
Several stages will be evaluated, the change of wire, SI are also taken into account.
For some special cases, it will be different with intuition.
FailReasons.description: There is no hold gain for current solution. Several stages will be evaluated, the change of wire, SI are also taken into account. And for some special cases, it will be different with intuition.
FailReasons.solution:
1. 适当增大eco_gain_threshold值，例如设置为0.05ns。
2. 避免使用split_net方法。
3. 使用以下命令设置参数：
xtop > set_parameter eco_gain_threshold 0.05

FailReasons.name: no_fanout_gain
reasons: After inserting buffer tree to split net, the new max fanout in the buffer tree is not getting smaller.
FailReasons.description: There is no fanout gain for current solution. When after inserting buffer tree to split net, the new max fanout in the buffer tree is not getting smaller.
FailReasons.solution: Adjust buffer tree insertion parameters, such as increasing the buffer size or modifying the fanout constraints. Use commands like 'set_buffer_tree -max_fanout <value>' to set appropriate fanout limits and re-run the buffer tree insertion process.

FailReasons.name: no_hold_margin
reasons: No hold margin on current pin
Hold slack is non-positive in any scenario
FailReasons.description: No hold margin on current pin. This is reported in fixing setup. Once the hold slack is non-positive of any scenario, this reason will be marked and the pin is skipped. It can be relaxed by specifying a negative hold margin.
FailReasons.solution: To resolve this issue, you can specify a negative hold margin using the 'eco_hold_slack_margin' command with a negative value. For example: eco_hold_slack_margin -margin -0.5

FailReasons.name: no_hold_total_gain
reasons: There is no hold gain in total for current solution
Sometimes, there exists on path gain, but the hold violations get worse
FailReasons.description: There is no hold gain in total for current solution. Sometimes, there exists on path gain, but the hold violations get worse. A total gain on local graph will be calculated to judge if the design can benefit from current solution as a total.

FailReasons.name: no_dynamic_power_gain
reasons: There is no dynamic power gain for current solution.
FailReasons.description: When optimize dynamic power, there's no gain after sizing cell.

FailReasons.name: no_setup_gain
reasons: There is no setup gain for current solution.
Several stages will be evaluated, the change of wire, SI are also taken into account.
For some special cases, it will be different with intuition.
FailReasons.description: There is no setup gain for current solution. Several stages will be evaluated, the change of wire, SI are also taken into account. And for some special cases, it will be different with intuition.
FailReasons.solution: Adjust the eco_gain_threshold parameter to a lower value to allow more changes. Example command: set_eco_gain_threshold -threshold 0.1

FailReasons.name: no_setup_margin
reasons: No setup margin on current pin
Setup slack is non-positive in any scenario
FailReasons.description: No setup margin on current pin. This is reported in fixing hold. Once the setup slack is non-positive of any scenario, this reason will be marked and the pin is skipped. It can be relaxed by specifying a negative setup margin.
FailReasons.solution: Use the eco_setup_slack_margin command to specify a negative setup margin. For example: eco_setup_slack_margin -margin -0.1

FailReasons.name: no_setup_total_gain
reasons: There is no setup gain in total for current solution
Sometimes, there exists on path gain, but the setup violations get worse
FailReasons.description: There is no setup gain in total for current solution. Sometimes, there exists on path gain, but the setup violations get worse. A total gain on local graph will be calculated to judge if the design can benefit from current solution as a total.

FailReasons.name: no_spare_or_ga_cell_found
reasons: There is no available spare or GA cell for postmask eco.
FailReasons.description: In postmask eco, tool can not find any valid spare cell or GA cell as candidate to fix violations.

FailReasons.name: no_transition_gain
reasons: There is no transition gain for current solution
The change of wire, SI are also taken into account
for some special cases, it will be different with intuition
FailReasons.description: There is no transition gain for current solution. The change of wire, SI are also taken into account. And for some special cases, it will be different with intuition.
FailReasons.solution: Adjust the eco_gain_threshold parameter to a lower value to allow more transitions to be considered. For example, set eco_gain_threshold to 0.1 using the command: set_eco_gain_threshold 0.1

FailReasons.name: no_transition_total_gain
reasons: There is no transition gain in total for current solution.
There exists gain for current net or pin, but the transition of the driver perhaps gets worst.
FailReasons.description: There is no transition gain in total for current solution. There exists gain for current net or pin, but the transition of the driver perhaps gets worst. A total gain will be calculated to judge if the design can benefit from current solution as a total.

FailReasons.name: no_physical_pin
reasons: The cell is missing in LEF file
the pin is missing on the LEF cell
FailReasons.description: The physical instance of pin does not exist. This happens while the cell is missing in LEF file, or the pin is missing on the LEF cell.
FailReasons.solution: Check the LEF file to ensure that the cell is present and contains the required pin. Use the 'check_lef' command with the appropriate cell name and pin name to verify their existence.

FailReasons.name: not_buffer_chain
reasons: The cell is not a buffer
The cell does not form an inverter pair with the cell after it
FailReasons.description: There is no buffer chain available at current pin. This reason is marked in removing buffer process while the cell is not a buffer or does not form an inverter pair with the cell after it.
FailReasons.solution: Check the cell type to ensure it is a buffer. If it is not, replace it with a buffer cell. Verify that the cell forms an inverter pair with the subsequent cell. Use the 'check_buffer_chain' command to validate the buffer chain configuration.

FailReasons.name: not_core_cell
reasons: The cell is not a core cell type
It may be defined as block or pad
FailReasons.description: The cell is not a core cell type, not supported for sizing. It may be defined as block or pad.

FailReasons.name: not_parallel_mib
reasons: The instances of multiple instantiated block are not in parallel relationship in design.
Some MIB instances drive instances with the same block.
设计中存在多次实例化的模块，但它们的逻辑层次不是平行/对等的
出现feed through直穿结构（红色）
feed through与其它R2R有关系
FailReasons.description: 在进行Top Level时序优化时，如果设计中的多次实例化模块（MIB）的逻辑层次不是平行/对等的，或者存在feed through直穿结构，或者feed through与其他R2R有关联，导致无法进行时序优化。
FailReasons.solution: 确保流水线结构中从M1进入M2的路径的startpoint不会在内部相互关联，XTop可以自动处理。若存在feed through结构，需检查并修改相关路径，确保模块实例间的逻辑层次为平行/对等。具体命令或参数设置需根据设计具体情况调整。

FailReasons.name: port_net
reasons: Current pin is design port
fanin driver is port
FailReasons.description: Current pin is design port, or fanin driver is port. Port is special, and is skipped in optimization process.

FailReasons.name: power_domain_conflict
reasons: There's conflict of power domain between driver and load in eco.
Usually caused by special cell like isolation cell or switch cell.
FailReasons.description: During eco process, there's power domain conflict between driver pin and load pin, usually caused by special cell like isolation cell or switch cell.
FailReasons.solution: Use report_power_domain to identify the conflicting power domains and resolve them by adjusting the power domain assignments or modifying the special cells involved.

FailReasons.name: power_intent_cell
reasons: The cell of pin for eco action is defined as power intent cell in UPF.
FailReasons.description: During eco process, found cell is defined as power intent cell in UPF.

FailReasons.name: sequential_cell
reasons: Current cell is a sequential cell.
FailReasons.description: Current cell is a sequential cell. Such cells will be skipped if only data paths are allowed to touch.

FailReasons.name: si_critical_net
reasons: Current net has large si
don't size the driver
FailReasons.description: When fix hold or optimize power, it's not suitable to weaken the net driver if this net has large si, so don't do size action for net driver.
FailReasons.solution: Use the eco_si_critical_net_rank_ratio command to adjust the critical net ranking ratio, which may help in managing the sizing of the driver appropriately.

FailReasons.name: special_power_domain
reasons: 尝试在特殊电源域（如always on）插入缓冲器或分割网络
目标电源域在UPF中被定义为特殊电源域
FailReasons.description: 当插入缓冲器或分割网络时，目标电源域是UPF中定义的特殊电源域（如always on），因此不允许插入。
FailReasons.solution: 检查UPF中定义的特殊电源域，并确保不在这些域中插入缓冲器或分割网络。可以使用以下命令查看电源域定义：check_power_domain -special

FailReasons.name: too_far_buffer
reasons: Buffer position is too far away from reference pin
FailReasons.description: When fix hold violation by inserting buffer chain, buffer position is too far away from reference pin, it should be skipped.

FailReasons.name: too_weak_drive_strength
reasons: When size down cell, drive strength decreases too much compared to original cell, larger than the threshold
For insert buffer, new buffer's drive strength decreases too much compared to its driver IP cell
During sizing down, the cell's drive strength becomes too weak, leading to significant signal integrity (SI) issues.
The sizing candidate's drive strength reduction exceeds the threshold defined by eco_size_cell_drive_strength_weaken_ratio parameter.
FailReasons.description: Candidate cell's drive strength is too weak, compared to original cell. When size down cell, drive strength decreases too much compared to original cell, larger than the threshold, may cause inaccurate evaluation result. For insert buffer, new buffer's drive strength decreases too much compared to its driver IP cell, may cause unreasonable evaluation result. This failure occurs when the drive strength of a cell is reduced too much during the sizing process, potentially causing signal integrity problems. The optimization process avoids adopting such solutions if the drive strength reduction exceeds the threshold set by the eco_size_cell_drive_strength_weaken_ratio parameter.
FailReasons.solution: Adjust the eco_size_cell_drive_strength_weaken_ratio parameter to a higher value to make the optimization more conservative. For example: xtop > set_parameter eco_size_cell_drive_strength_weaken_ratio 0.5 ;#more conservative. Then re-run the optimization process.

FailReasons.name: too_large_slack
reasons: Size cell methods can only fix violation points with small absolute slack.
FailReasons.description: When size cell, using absolute threshold and relative threshold to restrict slack.

FailReasons.name: unable_fix_by_dummy_cell
reasons: Hold slack can not be fixed by adding dummy cell
FailReasons.description: Hold slack can not be fixed by adding a dummy cell, suggest using other methods to fix the violation.

reasons: The parameter eco_skip_unconstrained_cell_rule is set to skip optimization for unconstrained cells.
FailReasons.description: When optimize leakage power or design area, if current cell's reference pin is unconstrained, XTop will skip optimization. This behavior is determined by parameter eco_skip_unconstrained_cell_rule.
FailReasons.solution: To resolve this issue, ensure that all relevant cells have proper constraints. Additionally, check and modify the eco_skip_unconstrained_cell_rule parameter if necessary. Use the following command to adjust the parameter: set_param eco_skip_unconstrained_cell_rule false
FailReasons.name: unconstrained_cell
off_path_violated_pin
reasons: Current pin's off path pin has setup violation
FailReasons.description: When using sizing down method to optimize setup timing, XTop will only size down off path cells that do not have setup violation.
FailReasons.solution: Use the 'set_timing_exceptions' command to specify the off-path constraints. Ensure that the off-path pins are correctly identified and excluded from setup checks using the 'create_clock_groups' command with the '-asynchronous' option if the paths are asynchronous. Additionally, verify that the sizing down process is applied only to cells without setup violations by checking the 'report_timing' output for any violations before optimization.

FailReasons.name: wrong_direction_net
reasons: Current net has wrong direction logical pin.
FailReasons.description: Current net traces some modules, and one or more logical pin's direction is wrong, so tool can't get right fanin or fanout result by direction.

FailReasons.name: illegal_net_to_split
reasons: Current net is illegal to split.
FailReasons.description: Detail route structure of current net is illegal for split net action.

FailReasons.name: dangling_pin_on_net
reasons: Current pin's connected net has dangling pin
illegal netlist
FailReasons.description: The net of current pin has a connection to dangling or unknown pin, usually caused by illegal netlist.

FailReasons.name: no_annotated_data_net
reasons: The net of current pin has no annotated data
There's no wire cap data
Wire cap is too small on any scenario
FailReasons.description: The net of current pin has no annotated data, which means there's no wire cap data, or wire cap is too small on any scenario, so skip auto eco for this pin.
FailReasons.solution: To resolve this issue, ensure that the net has proper annotated data by running the following commands: 1. Check and update wire cap data using 'set_wire_load_model' with appropriate parameters. 2. Verify the scenario settings to ensure wire cap sizes are adequate.

FailReasons.name: no_annotated_data_mib_net
reasons: Current pin is MIB pin, the net on other block has no annotated data.
FailReasons.description: The mib net of current pin has no annotated data, which means there's no wire cap data, or wire cap is too small on any scenario, so skip auto eco for this pin.

FailReasons.name: node_not_on_route
reasons: source node
hierarchy boundary node
steiner point
FailReasons.description: When doing split net, some special nodes is illegal to insert buffer, like source node, hierarchy boundary node, or steiner point, etc.
FailReasons.solution: Check the nodes involved in the split net operation and ensure that buffers are not inserted on source nodes, hierarchy boundary nodes, or steiner points. Use the 'check_nodes' command with the 'buffer_insertion' parameter set to 'exclude_special_nodes' to automatically exclude these nodes during buffer insertion.

FailReasons.name: node_drives_multi_module
reasons: 当进行split net操作时，某些节点驱动的引脚属于不同的逻辑模块
FailReasons.description: 当进行split net操作时，一些节点驱动的引脚属于不同的逻辑模块，生成原子eco命令时会被跳过。
FailReasons.solution: 需要确保在进行split net操作时，所有被驱动的引脚属于同一个逻辑模块。可以检查并调整模块划分，确保相关节点的引脚位于同一模块内。具体操作可能包括重新定义模块边界或调整节点连接关系。

FailReasons.name: PowerIntentCell
reasons: 遇到UPF设置的power inter cell
FailReasons.description: 在timing fix过程中，如果遇到通过UPF命令设置的power intent cell，会触发此失败原因。这通常发生在设计中存在UPF定义的电源意图单元，但可能未正确映射或配置相关库单元。
FailReasons.solution: 确保使用正确的UPF命令映射电源意图单元到库单元，例如：map_isolation_cell xx -domain PD_X -lib_cells {lib_cell_list}，并检查所有相关的UPF设置是否正确应用。

FailReasons.name: PowerDomainConflict
reasons: 遇到lib中的iso/level shifter/always-on CELL, always-on/switch PIN
FailReasons.description: 当在timing fix过程中遇到库中的iso（隔离）、level shifter（电平移位器）、always-on CELL或always-on/switch PIN时，会触发PowerDomainConflict失败原因。这通常发生在设计中存在与电源域定义冲突的库单元或引脚时。
FailReasons.solution: 确保库文件中的单元和引脚定义与电源域设置一致。检查并修正库中的iso、level shifter、always-on CELL或always-on/switch PIN的定义，确保它们与UPF中定义的电源域（Power Domain）相匹配。如果需要，使用UPF命令显式设置这些单元的电源意图，例如：set_isolation xx -domain PD_X ... 或 map_isolation_cell xx -domain PD_X -lib_cells {lib_cell_list}。

reasons: setup hold 互相卡
placement density 过高
net detour 过大，导致对插入buffer 的delay 估计失真
Fix hold 在低压corner 下的path 上insert 了很多的delay cell
Fix hold 之后因为net detour 的原因，setup timing 飞掉了
Fix hold 之后发现和某个memory 相关的setup timing 飞了

setup hold 互相卡.name: setup hold 互相卡
reasons: setup hold 互相卡
placement density 过高
net detour 过大，导致对插入buffer 的delay 估计失真
Fix hold 在低压corner 下的path 上insert 了很多的delay cell
Fix hold 之后因为net detour 的原因，setup timing 飞掉了
Fix hold 之后发现和某个memory 相关的setup timing 飞了
setup hold 互相卡.description: Q11: 有哪些原因会导致XTop fix hold timing 效果不佳？ A： ① setup hold 互相卡 ② placement density 过高 ③ net detour 过大，导致对插入buffer 的delay 估计失真 Fix hold 之后，导致setup timing 飞掉了，可能会因为： 1. Fix hold 在低压corner 下的path 上insert 了很多的delay cell，导致 setup timing 飞了。通过report_annotated_pin 进行debug，发现有 violation 的pin 上没有voltage 信息，导致对transition 和delay 评估不 准。在dump STA data 的时候dump 了所有pin 的voltage 后问题得以解决。 2. Fix hold 之后，因为net detour 的原因，setup timing 飞掉了。原因是 scan 的tree 不平，工具在一个区域插了很多buffer 和delay cell，导致 绕线detour，transition 变大很多。 3. Fix hold 之后，发现和某个memory 相关的setup timing 飞了。在P*中 report 对应的timing， 发现transition 变大很多。同时在XTop 和innv*中 查看对应的physical view，发现memory 的pin location 改变了。最终替换到最新的LEF 之后，问题得以解决。
setup hold 互相卡.solution: 1. 使用report_annotated_pin命令检查有violation的pin的voltage信息，确保所有pin的voltage信息正确。 2. 在dump STA data时，确保dump所有pin的voltage信息。 3. 检查scan tree的平衡性，避免在某一区域插入过多buffer和delay cell。 4. 检查memory的pin location是否发生变化，替换为最新的LEF文件。

FailReasons.name: PinVoltageMissing
reasons: Fix hold 在低压corner 下的path 上insert 了很多的delay cell
Fix hold 之后，因为net detour 的原因，setup timing 飞掉了
Fix hold 之后，memory 的pin location 改变了
FailReasons.description: 在Fix hold之后，由于插入了大量delay cell或net detour导致setup timing问题，violation的pin上没有voltage信息，导致transition和delay评估不准。
FailReasons.solution: 通过report_annotated_pin进行debug，确保所有pin的voltage信息被正确dump。在dump STA data时，确保所有pin的voltage被正确记录。替换到最新的LEF文件以修正memory pin location问题。

FailReasons.name: transition_and_delay_miscalculation
reasons: Fix hold 在低压corner 下的path 上insert 了很多的delay cell，导致setup timing 飞了
Fix hold 之后，因为net detour 的原因，setup timing 飞掉了
Fix hold 之后，发现和某个memory 相关的setup timing 飞了
FailReasons.description: 在Fix hold之后，由于插入过多的delay cell、net detour导致绕线detour以及memory pin location改变，导致transition和delay评估不准，进而引发setup timing问题。
FailReasons.solution:
1. 使用report_annotated_pin检查violation的pin是否有voltage信息，确保dump STA data时包含所有pin的voltage信息。
2. 检查net detour情况，优化buffer和delay cell的插入位置，减少绕线detour。
3. 检查memory的pin location是否改变，替换到最新的LEF文件以确保物理视图正确。

FailReasons.name: machine resource (mem and cpu) issues
reasons: 机器资源（内存和CPU）不足
使用bsub方式提交任务时，某些特殊情况下无法开启交互模式
FailReasons.description: 当xtop的manual无法正常打开和查询时，可能是由于当前运行的机器资源（内存和CPU）不足，或者使用bsub方式提交任务时在某些特殊情况下无法开启交互模式。
FailReasons.solution:
1. 检查当前机器的内存和CPU使用情况，可使用命令如top、htop、free -m等。
2. 确认xtop job的提交方式是否为bsub方式，如果不是，请改用其他方式提交任务。
3. 如果问题仍然存在，请联系客户IT部门或PE/RD团队进行进一步确认和解决。

FailReasons.name: bsub submission method limitations
reasons: bsub方式在某些特殊情况下无法开启交互模式
未确认xtop当前运行下的机器资源、内存及CPU情况
未确认xtop job的提交方式是否为bsub方式
FailReasons.description: 当使用bsub方式提交xtop job时，在某些特殊情况下可能无法开启交互模式，导致man命令无法正常工作。需要确认机器资源、内存及CPU情况，并确认job提交方式。
FailReasons.solution:
1. 检查当前xtop运行的机器资源、内存及CPU使用情况。
2. 确认xtop job的提交方式是否为bsub方式。
3. 如果问题仍然存在，联系客户IT部门进行确认。
4. 在本地机器下直接联系PE/RD团队解决问题。

FailReasons.name: read_timing_data阶段报错
reasons: 该pin在pin slack file及pin timing file中均没有反标信息
FailReasons.description: 当某个pin在pin slack file和pin timing file中都没有反标信息时，xtop工具在read_timing_data阶段会报错，导致无法继续设置dont_touch属性。
FailReasons.solution: 确保pin在pin slack file或pin timing file中至少有一个有反标信息。可以检查并生成正确的timing数据文件，使用正确的命令如read_timing_data并指定正确的文件路径。如果文件不存在，需要生成或导入相应的timing数据。

FailReasons.name: dont touch
reasons: 部分MIB pin被设为black box后，剩余pin无法设置dont touch属性
在时序修复过程中未正确识别或处理dont touch标记
FailReasons.description: 当MIB的某些引脚被设置为black box后，剩余引脚可以设置为dont touch属性，但在进行时序修复时，工具可能无法正确识别或处理这些dont touch标记，导致失败。
FailReasons.solution: 使用get_dont_touch_pin命令获取已设置的dont touch引脚，并确保在时序修复前正确应用该属性。具体步骤包括：1. 使用set_instance_black_box命令设置black box；2. 使用set_dont_touch命令设置剩余引脚的dont touch属性；3. 在时序修复前调用get_dont_touch_pin验证设置。

FailReasons.name: ECO_Failure
reasons: Timing path issues
DRV (Driving Resistance Value) bottlenecks
Clock ECO analysis errors
Incorrect buffer insertion or sizing
Improper load splitting or net splitting
Failed cell removal or relocation
Clock pin re-connection errors
FailReasons.description: Failures related to Electronic Design Optimization (ECO) operations during timing analysis and physical design adjustments, including timing path issues, DRV bottlenecks, clock analysis errors, and incorrect implementation of ECO operations like buffer insertion, load splitting, and cell relocation.
FailReasons.solution: Use the Advanced Timing Bottleneck Analyzer to identify specific timing paths and DRV issues. Apply graph-based ECO operations with commands like 'insert_buffer', 'size_cell', 'split_load', 'split_net', 'remove_buffer', 'move_cell', and 'reconnect_clock_pin'. Ensure real-time cross-probing between timing paths and layout for accurate adjustments. For clock ECO, use high-efficiency analysis tools and verify all changes with 'analyze_timing' and 'check_eco' commands.

FailReasons.name: TimingPathsTableSlackDisplayFailure
reasons: Timing Paths Table fails to display correct slack values
Incorrect configuration of the path viewer display options
Issues with the timing analysis data not being properly updated or calculated
FailReasons.description: The Timing Paths Table may fail to display correct slack values due to incorrect configuration of the path viewer display options, issues with the timing analysis data not being properly updated or calculated, or other related factors.
FailReasons.solution: 1. Check and configure the path viewer display options via the Options Tab, ensuring that the correct columns (e.g., Cur/Orig Slack) are selected for display. 2. Re-run the timing analysis using the 'analyze_timing' command with appropriate parameters to ensure data is updated. 3. Verify the timing constraints and ensure they are correctly applied using 'set_timing_constraints'.
Command "clear_fail_reasons" can be used to clear all existing fail reasons.

FailReasons.name: Break_hold
reasons: Break_hold
FailReasons.description: Break_hold is a fail reason indicating that the hold timing constraint is violated due to the insertion of buffers or other changes in the design that disrupt the hold timing path.
FailReasons.solution:
To resolve Break_hold issues, consider the following steps:
1. Use the ECO (Engineering Change Order) process to adjust the design.
2. Check and optimize buffer insertions on the critical path.
3. Run the timing analysis again after making changes to ensure hold constraints are met.

FailReasons.name: Sequential_cell
reasons: No_setup_gain
Fail_to_legalize
Break_hold
Sequential_cell
Break_max_capacitance
No_setup_total_gain
Assigned_net
FailReasons.description: 详细解释
FailReasons.solution: 解决方案，包括具体的命令、参数设置步骤

FailReasons.name: break hold of driver
reasons: Driver cannot maintain hold time requirements due to timing constraints
Insufficient buffer insertion or sizing to meet hold time
Path delay variations causing hold violations
FailReasons.description: The 'break hold of driver' failure reason indicates that the driver cell is unable to meet the hold time requirements on its output pin. This typically occurs when the delay from the driver to the load is too great or when there are insufficient buffers to maintain the required timing.
FailReasons.solution: Use the report_fail_reasons command with -paths and -pins options to identify specific paths and pins causing the issue. Insert buffers on critical paths using the insert_buffer command, and adjust buffer sizes with the size_cell command. Check and adjust timing constraints using set_timing_constraints. Example: xtop > report_fail_reasons -paths [get_paths -delay_type max] -stats; xtop > insert_buffer -path Path_xxx; xtop > size_cell -path Path_xxx -size medium

reasons: break max cap
no setup gain
break hold of driver
no place to legalize
sequential_cell
no_setup_gain
break_hold

break max cap.name: break max cap
reasons: break max cap
no setup gain
break hold of driver
no place to legalize
sequential_cell
no_setup_gain
break_hold
break max cap.description: The reason for the failure is related to the maximum capacitance of the pin being exceeded, which can occur due to various factors such as the pin's capacitance being too high for the driver, the setup gain not being sufficient, the hold of the driver being broken, the lack of space to legalize the placement, the use of a sequential cell, or the absence of setup gain.
break max cap.solution: To resolve this issue, you can use the report_fail_reasons command with the -paths option to identify the specific paths and pins affected. For example: xtop > report_fail_reasons -paths [get_paths -delay_type max] -stats. Additionally, you can use the -pins option to focus on specific pins that are violating the constraints, such as: xtop > report_fail_reasons -pins [get_setup_gba_violated_pins] -stats -verbose. Once identified, you can use the Insert Buffer, Size Cell, Split Net, or Remove Buffer options to adjust the design and meet the capacitance requirements.

reasons: break hold of driver
break_hold
break hold
break hold of driver
break_hold
FailReasons.name: break hold
FailReasons.description: 详细解释
FailReasons.solution: xtop > report_fail_reasons -paths [get_paths -delay_type max] -stats

FailReasons.name: dont_touch
reasons: 对象（cell, net, pin, path）被主动设置为dont touch属性
从第三方注释文件中读取并honored的dont touch属性
在优化指令中使用-only_pins选项指定pin列表，导致未指定的pin被临时视为dont touch
FailReasons.description: 当一个对象（cell, net, pin, path）被设置为dont touch时，工具不会在优化过程中修改该对象。对于路径而言，工具不会尝试修复该路径上的违例，这将导致失败原因。检查dont touch属性可使用get_dont_touch_cells, get_dont_touch_nets, get_dont_touch_pins命令，以及is_dont_touch命令。通过fix命令给定指定pin列表导致其他pin被标记为dont touch是临时的，优化完成后标签会被删除。
FailReasons.solution:
1. 使用set_dont_touch/set_module_dont_touch/set_hier_path_dont_touch命令将对象的dont touch属性设置为false。
2. 关闭honor_annotated_dont_touch参数以忽略第三方注释文件中的dont touch属性。

File.name: tech.lef
File.usage: 技术层定义文件，用于在XTop工具中链接参考库，包含工艺相关的信息，如层定义、规则等，使用时通过link_reference_library命令导入，与其他LEF文件（如cell.lef）一起定义设计的物理实现约束。

File.name: cell.lef
File.usage: 该文件是参考库文件，用于在XTop工具中进行设计设置时链接参考库，包含单元的几何信息和设计规则，通过link_reference_library命令与tech.lef一起导入，用于设计导入和布局规划。

File.name: blockA.v
File.usage: blockA.v 是一个Verilog源文件，用于定义设计模块。在XTop工具中，它被导入到工作区并用于设计设置，与其他文件如blockB.v、top.v以及对应的def文件一起参与布局和检查。

File.name: blockB.v
File.usage: blockB.v是设计的一部分，包含Verilog代码，用于在XTop工具中定义设计。该文件需要与其他Verilog文件（如blockA.v和top.v）以及对应的def文件（blockA.def、blockB.def、top.def）一起导入到工作区，以进行设计布局和检查。

File.name: top.v
File.usage: 文件用途，描述这个文件包含什么内容、如何使用

File.name: blockA.def
File.usage: blockA.def文件用于在XTop工具中定义blockA的设计信息，包含布局信息，该文件在导入design时被使用，与对应的Verilog文件blockA.v一起被define_designs命令指定，用于设计的布局和规划。

File.name: blockB.def
File.usage: blockB.def文件用于在XTop工具中定义blockB模块的版图信息，该文件在导入设计时被使用，与blockB.v一起作为设计输入。

File.name: top.def
File.usage: 文件用途，描述这个文件包含什么内容、如何使用

File.name: lib2.lib
File.usage: lib2.lib is a timing library file used in the XTop tool for linking timing libraries during the MCMM (Multi-Corner Multi-Mode) setup. It is associated with a specific corner and mode scenario and is used to provide timing characteristics for the design under different process corners and operating modes. The file is linked using the 'link_timing_library' command with the '-search_type min_max' option, which indicates that it is used for timing analysis considering both minimum and maximum timing variations.

File.name: fanout_fix.tcl
File.usage: 用于修复时序中的扇出问题，包含相关修复命令和脚本。该文件位于timing_scripts目录下，通常在完成时序检查后，通过source命令调用以执行扇出修复操作。

File.name: pre_opt.rpt
File.usage: 该文件用于记录修复hold timing之前的违规情况，通过summarize_gba_violations命令生成，包含exclude_path、as_reference和hold参数的违规摘要。该文件在优化前后都会生成，用于对比分析。

File.name: verilogs
File.usage: 文件用途，描述这个文件包含什么内容、如何使用

File.name: brief_xx.log
File.usage: 在开头和末尾对应fix的信息，用于简单判断哪一步存在问题

File.name: tlef
File.usage: 用于通过标识rule关联7nm/5nm工艺，当corner对应的电压在0.7v以下时，工具自动调整derate值为1.05（setup时序）和1.02（leakage优化）

File.name: Verilog
File.usage: 文件包含设计的逻辑描述，用于定义设计的层次结构。通过define_designs命令与DEF文件一起分析，自动生成设计定义。需按依赖顺序从底层到顶层逐个定义。使用时需确保文件存在且可读，或使用-force选项跳过错误。文件用途包括作为XTop工具的输入文件，用于进行ECO脚本和增量SDF的生成，同时用于描述设计的硬件行为，通过import_designs命令导入，并使用report_design_file_status命令检查导入状态。文件示例为/cpu.v.gz。需要与其他文件如LEF、DEF、Power Domain Files、Lib Files和Timing Data Files一起使用。

File.name: DEF
File.usage: DEF文件用于描述集成电路的物理设计布局信息，包含组件的位置、布线、宏单元、引脚位置、电源网络、单元放置、布线约束等数据。在XTop工具中，DEF文件作为输入数据之一，用于处理和生成ECO脚本及增量SDF文件，同时支持输出增量DEF结果（incr. DEF result）以及增强DEF解析，支持无类型的REGION约束。DEF文件可与Verilog文件一起通过define_designs命令分析创建设计定义，需按依赖顺序从下到上逐个定义设计，若文件不存在或不可读默认报错但可通过-force选项强制继续执行。通过import_designs命令导入设计的物理布局信息后，可使用report_design_file_status命令检查导入状态及解析日志，导入失败时文件会被标记为失败并忽略内容。例如DEF文件路径为/.../tutorial/input_files/design_data/cpu.def.gz，成功导入后报告中会显示DEF : succeeded。

File.name: LEF
File.usage: LEF文件用于描述标准单元库的几何信息和引脚信息，是物理设计中用于布局和布线的重要输入文件。在XTop工具中，LEF文件作为输入数据之一，用于支持物理设计流程中的相关操作。

File.name: Liberty
File.usage: Liberty文件包含单元库信息，用于时序分析和约束。在XTop中，Liberty文件作为输入之一，用于处理STA Timing数据，支持生成ECO脚本和增量SDF文件。

File.name: STA Timing 数据
File.usage: STA Timing 数据是XTop的输入数据之一，用于在XTop工具中进行时序分析和优化，生成ECO脚本和增量SDF文件。

File.name: ECO 脚本
File.usage: XTop输出的ECO脚本用于实现设计变更，包含增量SDF输出。该脚本基于输入的Verilog、DEF、LEF、Liberty和STA Timing数据生成，用于在X86 64-bit Linux操作系统（如Red Hat Enterprise V6、V7）上执行设计修改。

File.name: incr. SDF
File.usage: 该文件是XTop工具的输出文件，包含增量静态时序分析（Incremental Static Timing Analysis）的结果。用于在物理设计流程中，对时序进行增量更新和验证，通常在布局布线（Place and Route）后使用，以检查设计是否满足时序约束。

File.name: Verilog/DEF/Power domain
File.usage: design information (netlist, physical, power domain files)

File.name: native eco script files
File.usage: 用于在XTop工具中加载并合并多个设计师并行工作的ECO脚本，避免ECO操作冲突。文件包含ECO操作指令，如size_cell等，合并时仅更新网表和合法性，不更新时序。

File.name: eco script files
File.usage: import several eco script files in native format, and try to merge them. XTop will enter the "timing irrelevant" mode, and print "Enter timing irrelevant mode for merging ECO actions" information on the shell. In this mode, tool will check for conflicts and duplications between eco script files. All ECO actions will only update netlist and legalization, and timing is not updated.

File.name: STA tools report
File.usage: The STA tools report contains enhanced timing data and report format, which are used for analyzing and verifying the timing performance of the design. It is utilized to ensure that the design meets the required timing constraints and to identify any timing violations or issues during the implementation and optimization phases.

File.name: icexplorer-xtop-2017.09-rhel5-x86_64-20171015.tar.gz
File.usage: The tar.gz file containing the ICExplorer-XTop package. It can be installed by extracting it using the command: tar zxvf icexplorer-xtop-2017.09-rhel5-x86_64-20171015.tar.gz

File.name: UPF
File.usage: 用于导入电源域配置，通过import_power_domain命令，可选参数 -upf_file 指定文件名。

File.name: region file
File.usage: 用于导入电源域配置，与UPF文件类似，包含电源域信息，适用于分层设计中多个电源域的情况。使用import_power_domain命令并指定-region_file参数来加载。

Timing library files are linked to the specified corner. By default, the library is used for both min and max analysis in this corner. LVF libraries for advanced process are supported. Use command unlink_timing_library to unlink timing library files from specified corner. The command xtop> link_timing_library -corner cornerName \ [-search_type min|max|min_max] files is used to link the timing library files.

File.name: sta log
File.usage: 记录静态时序分析（STA）的执行结果，包括时序违规摘要、最差 Slack 值、路径信息等。通过命令如 summarize_gba_violations 可提取和分析时序违规数据，用于调试和优化设计。

File.name: sta log文件
File.usage: 该文件包含静态时序分析（STA）过程中生成的日志信息，用于记录时序检查、约束应用、路径分析、命令执行结果、警告和错误信息等详细内容。用户可通过查看该文件诊断时序违规问题、验证设计是否满足时序要求，并跟踪优化过程中的变化。文件支持通过report_path、report_fanout_arc等命令生成，包含时序路径详细信息及扇出时序弧数据。通过 -data_dir 参数指定时序数据目录，-force_read 参数可强制重新读取pin timing文件。当需处理大量路径时，应将结果重定向到文件并设置合理截断数量。此外，summarize_leakage_power等命令的输出（如漏电流功率统计信息）也可能被记录，用于功耗优化分析。在ECO工具（如XTop）中，该文件用于更新时序信息，手修timing后需在STA中重新update timing并导出数据以确保准确性。
记录设置电源轨电压的命令和参数，用于静态时序分析（STA）中定义不同场景、角落和模式下的电压值。通过该文件可以查看和验证设计中各个单元在不同条件下的电压设置情况。

File.name: timing data
File.usage: The timing data files contain pin slack information and are used to provide timing information for analysis. They are read once by XTop unless the -data_dir has been changed by the user or the -force_read option is specified. The files store specific design library cell information via set_specific_lib_cells command, containing detailed data for timing analysis and verification. They include timing data for cells, nets, and pins such as setup/hold times, voltage drop, and wire delay, supporting reporting with options like -cells, -nets, -pins, -verbose, -include_skipped, and -truncate. The files also contain timing analysis data passed to XTop after STA (Static Timing Analysis) updates, and are used for interactive ECO operations including timing path analysis, bottleneck analysis, real-time cross-probing, and graph-based ECO operations (e.g., inserting buffers, adjusting loads, reconnecting clock pins).

File.name: pin slack files
File.usage: contains timing data; used to provide timing information for the design, read by XTop when -data_dir is specified or -force_read is used to force re-reading

File.name: timing_data_dir
File.usage: 该文件用于存储时序数据，供analyze_scenario_reduction和read_timing_data命令使用，包含场景减少分析所需的数据，如Hold Count、Hold TNS、Setup Count、Setup TNS等信息，以及被丢弃的场景列表。

File.name: DEF file
File.usage: DEF文件用于该设计，包含设计的布局信息，通过-def参数指定文件名。

File.name: region_file
File.usage: 定义电源域和物理区域之间的映射关系，用于导入电源域配置时指定电源域与物理区域的对应关系。该文件在import_power_domain命令中使用，与UPF文件一起或单独使用以配置电源域信息。
读取时序数据文件，用于分析和验证设计的时序特性。文件由STA工具生成，包含预定义命名格式的文件，包含每个场景的时序数据。使用read_timing_data命令从指定目录读取，需要所有必要的文件存在，否则报告错误。可选参数包括忽略时序报告、内存节省模式等。

File.name: incremental sdf flow
File.usage: 该文件用于增量SDF流程，包含除全局松弛度以外的所有其他数据。在使用read_timing_data命令时，可以通过-ignore_data_for_sdf标志来跳过读取其他数据，仅保留全局松弛度。此文件由STA工具生成，需遵循预定义的命名格式。

File.name: 2.rpt.gz
File.usage: 用于读取指定场景的时序报告，可以通过 -pretend 选项并行读取多个场景的时序报告，实际读取发生在最后一个不带 -pretend 选项的命令执行时。

File.name: 3.rpt.gz
File.usage: 文件用途，描述这个文件包含什么内容、如何使用

File.name: 4.rpt.gz
File.usage: 文件用途，描述这个文件包含什么内容、如何使用

File.name: def/sub_design.def.gz
File.usage: DEF文件，用于记录设计的物理布局信息，包含单元的位置、布线等信息。在使用report_design_file_status命令时，可以检查该文件的链接状态和解析错误/警告信息。

File.name: image_file_name
File.usage: 用于生成图像文件，以可视化网络的断开部分。当网络存在多个断开部分时，该文件会用不同颜色标记每个部分，并用圆圈表示网络引脚。
文件用途，描述这个文件包含什么内容、如何使用

File.name: timing library file
File.usage: 文件包含时序库数据，用于报告文件状态，检查解析错误和警告信息。通过命令report_timing_library_file_status可以查看文件是否成功链接，以及相关的错误和警告信息。

File.name: LEF library
File.usage: LEF library contains site information that is used to map sites from DEF files to the corresponding sites in the LEF library. It is used in conjunction with the set_site_map command to ensure that site names from DEF files (which may be meaningless) are correctly mapped to the appropriate sites in the LEF library, which is necessary for proper design processing.

File.name: native_netlist_regs0.txt
File.usage: 该文件是native格式的eco文件，用于在不更新时序的情况下加载设计更改。文件中的内容包含可能与之前操作冲突的eco操作，冲突时会报告信息并丢弃当前操作。文件通过load_native_eco_files命令加载，例如：% load_native_eco_files { native_netlist_regs0.txt native_netlist_regs1.txt }。

File.name: native_netlist_regs1.txt
File.usage: 该文件是native格式的eco文件，用于在不更新时序的情况下加载设计更改。文件中的内容包含需要应用的eco操作，这些操作可能与之前的操作冲突，冲突时会报告信息并丢弃当前eco操作。文件通过load_native_eco_files命令加载，可选参数-quiet用于抑制丢弃操作时的消息输出。

File.name: native_netlist_regs.txt
File.usage: 该文件是用于在不更新时序的情况下加载原生格式的eco文件。文件包含eco操作，这些操作可能与之前的操作冲突，导致当前eco操作被丢弃。如果布局合法化失败，eco操作将被丢弃或导致单元格重叠。
文件包含设计中实例位移的信息，包括最大、最小、平均位移，以及按距离排序的实例名称和位置信息。用于分析芯片设计中单元的物理位移情况，帮助识别可能的布局问题。

File.name: verilog
File.usage: 该文件包含整个当前设计的完整内容，用于保存设计变更。通过write_design_changes命令生成，当指定-format V_DEF时，会将设计变更写入增量def文件，并将整个当前设计写入verilog文件。文件包含子模块的电路描述，用于导入设计层次结构，通常不需要额外提取为timing lib，只需导入对应的verilog、def、lef文件即可。文件包含模块的代码，用于在导入设计时进行加载和验证。当导入包含大量filler单元的DEF文件时，可能导致内存或磁盘空间不足，或名称空间超出限制，需检查并移除不必要的filler单元。

File.name: incremental def file
File.usage: 包含设计更改，用于在写入设计更改时生成增量DEF文件，通常与其他文件（如verilog文件）一起使用以记录设计的当前状态。通过write_design_changes命令生成，使用-format V_DEF参数指定。

File.name: timing library
File.usage: timing library文件用于提供设计在不同corner下的时序信息。通过link_timing_library命令将文件链接到设计中，然后使用report_timing_library_file_status命令检查各个corner下的timing lib文件状态，确保文件正确链接。例如，文件路径如/.../tutorial/input_files/lib/tutoriallvtbc.idb和/.../tutorial/input_files/lib/tutoriallvtwc.idb分别对应fast和slow corner。

File.name: tech lef
File.usage: tech lef 文件用于定义不同工艺技术的库信息，当设计中混合使用多种工艺时，需要分别通过link_reference_library命令并使用-tech_group选项来指定不同的tech group，然后通过set_tech_group命令将设计模块与对应的tech group关联，以确保正确导入和使用不同工艺的布局信息。

File.name: def
File.usage: 文件用途，描述这个文件包含什么内容、如何使用

File.name: lef
File.usage: 文件用途，描述这个文件包含什么内容、如何使用

File.name: func_fast_data_pin_timing.txt.gz
File.usage: 该文件包含pin transition timing（引脚转换时序）信息，用于时序分析和优化，特别是在不同scenario条件下分析设计的时序信息。用户可以通过STA工具中的脚本导出此类文件。

File.name: func_fast_data_total_capacitances.txt.gz
File.usage: parasitic data

File.name: func_fast_data_pin_slack.txt.gz
File.usage: 该文件包含全局松弛度（global slack）信息，用于时序分析和优化，描述设计在不同场景下的时序信息。用户可通过STA工具提供的脚本导出此类timing data文件。

File.name: func_fast_data_timing_rpt.txt.gz
File.usage: timing report data

File.name: .lib
File.usage: 时序库文件，包含时序信息，用于STA（静态时序分析）。在导入时，如果文件较大，建议先转换为.idb格式以加速导入过程。转换可通过lib2idb工具完成，但此方法仅加速时序库文件导入，不适用于STA数据导入加速。
用于存储时序库数据，通过转换.lib文件生成，以加速时序库文件的导入过程。使用lib2idb工具进行转换，转换后的.idb文件可以按照.lib文件的方式导入，但此方法仅加速时序库导入，不适用于STA数据导入加速。

File.name: sta_data/cpu_data_timing_rpt.txt
File.usage: 该文件包含timing report信息，用于通过read_timing_report命令读入，需指定scenario参数（如fast_worst）。使用前建议用purge_timing_paths清空当前数据，避免数据冲突。默认scenario为reference。

文件包含时序报告信息，用于增量读入时序数据。使用read_timing_report命令指定scenario参数读取，例如：xtop> read_timing_report -scenario fast_worst sta_data/cpu_data_timing_rpt.txt。读取前建议使用purge_timing_paths清空当前数据，防止数据冲突。默认scenario为reference。
文件包含时序数据，用于在XTop中读取和验证时序信息。通过检查文件头部的design和current inst名称以及反标率，确保时序数据与netlist匹配。

File.name: <scenario>_data_total_capacitances.txt.gz
File.usage: 该文件包含与特定scenario相关的总电容数据，用于在进行timing eco时，XTop工具需要所有scenario的数据以确保优化后所有scenario的timing都能被评估。若某scenario的数据缺失，XTop将无法评估该scenario的timing，导致报错'no_annotated_data_net'。该文件用于检查和确保所有scenario的timing数据完备性。

File.name: timing_rpt file
File.usage: 文件包含与定时数据相关的信息，用于检查和诊断timing_data文件中的异常，例如输入端口前面的pin到该端口的delay信息。在出现错误时，需要查看该文件中log提示的行以确定问题原因。
用于在ECO时序优化前保存当前工作区，以便后续需要时可以恢复到该状态。用户可以在read_timing_data后、ECO之前使用save_workspace -as命令进行保存。

File.name: workspace
File.usage: 用于保存设计的当前状态，以便在需要时恢复到之前的版本。在执行ECO（工程变更订单）操作前，建议使用save_workspace -as命令进行保存，以便在需要撤销操作时恢复设计。

File.name: img_page0055_fig0001.png
File.usage: 该图片用于展示在使用set_removable_fillers指令后，xtop工具不会进行filler回填的示意图。图中显示对一个buffer进行size up后，右侧空余空间未被filler填满，用户需返回到pr tool进行回填。

File.name: t*s_util2_turbo_mode.tcl
File.usage: 该文件是用于在2018.12版本后的工具中，从tps流程中导出turbo mode的脚本。用户可以通过运行此脚本实现turbo mode的相关操作，具体使用方法请参考文档中的说明。

File.name: STA tool UG
File.usage: 该文件详细介绍了HyperScale技术，包括其如何分层次化地分析block级和top级部分，以及如何准确处理top级和low-level块之间的定时接口，提供了全平面分析的准确性同时减少运行时和内存占用的分层块级分析方法。

File.name: test_file
File.usage: 在XTop模式下，通过tcl语言交互创建的文件，用于存储或处理数据。使用方法是通过执行tcl命令'exec touch test_file'来创建该文件。

File.name: STA log
File.usage: The STA log file contains timing analysis data processed by the Empyrean XTop™ tool, which is used as input for generating ECO scripts and QoR reports. It is part of the input requirements along with layout files (Verilog LEF/DEF) to process timing constraints and produce outputs such as netlist ECO scripts, QoR reports, and P&R ECO scripts.
